ol.li: SPRING BREAK - April 6-10, is Spring Break. PWCS will honor Spring Break for employees and families as planned. Please know that most staff will be off next week as scheduled and will not be expected to respond to emails or other communications while on leave. School Food and Nutrition Services will continue to serve meals during Spring Break. April 13 will continue to be a planned Teacher Workday with teachers working remotely.

SCHOOL BOARD MEETING - The Prince William County School Board met Wednesday, April 1, to hear a presentation by Dr. Steve Walts, Superintendent of Schools, about the Division’s response to the pandemic. You can view the School Board meeting here. Highlights from Dr. Walts regarding the Learning Plan include:
My highest priority remains the physical and mental health of students and staff.
It is simply not fair, nor realistic, to expect our teachers, students, and administrators - or families - to replicate the school day at home.
I want our teachers to know, our students to know, and our staff to know – it’s OK.
We are all in this together – we will work together to do the best we can to support one another – and that’s what matters.
Given this remarkable time we are in – it is my expectation that we provide students with as much latitude and grace as possible.
Consistent with Virginia Department of Education guidance, students’ grades will only be able to go up from where they were on March 13.

CONTINUITY OF LEARNING – PWCS has released details of the Phase 4 of the Continuity of Learning Plan* for all students, that will begin April 14 following Spring Break and the Teacher Workday. This plan provides more specific direction on the Virtual Schoolhouse and how to successfully navigate learning virtually. Additionally, this timeline provides further information on all six phases of the entire Continuity of Learning Plan. Families are asked to allow our school leaders time to work with their teachers after Spring Break, and the Teacher Workday, prior to contacting their teachers or school with questions.
SPECIAL EDUCATION RESOURCES – More resources have been posted to provide support for students with special needs and their families.

MEAL PICK-UP INFORMATION – USDA has created a waiver for parents to be allowed to collect meals without their children. Meals will continue to be available during Spring Break. PWCS has expanded meal pick-ups to three more school sites beginning April 6, including Potomac View Elementary School, River Oaks Elementary School and Saunders Middle School. More detailed information can be found here.

COMPUTER ACCESS – As outlined in Dr. Walts' remarks (see #2 above), parents and guardians of high school students should be aware of a phone survey next week to assess the needs of students who may not have a computer at home. Surveys of additional grade levels will be scheduled later this month.

div.p: *Due to the challenges related to this historical world health event and national emergency; it will be necessary for our teams to adapt how we support our students. As a result of Governor Northam’s order, PWCS schools must remain closed for the remainder of the school year. As we ensure the safety and well-being of students, PWCS can no longer offer its students an instructional day and services on IEPs, 504 plans, gifted education plans, and required EL services as it does when schools are open for instruction. In the place of instruction, our schools and team members are implementing the following plan to provide students with opportunities to learn, to challenge themselves, and to review and retain past lessons. All teachers will work collaboratively and use proactive strategies to continue engagement in learning for all students including our English learners, special education, dually identified, and twice exceptional students providing the supports possible given the limitations of virtual learning under these conditions.

hr.br:
March 27, 2020 Updates
New Information
STAY SAFE AND HEALTHY – the highest priority now is to stay healthy. Parents and guardians should follow CDC Guidelines for physical distancing of children. If children meet outside of school in bigger groups, it can put everyone at risk. Please visit the Prince William County COVID-19 website to see additional local guidance.
PWCS AND PARENT PARTNERSHIP FOR HOME LEARNING – STUDENT LEARNING CONTINUES - Although our school buildings and grounds are closed, learning is open, and staff and teachers are working daily. First and foremost, we want all families to know that the continued learning of our students is important to us.
In the very limited time following the closure announcement, PWCS has rapidly developed detailed plans to ensure continuity of learning through the remainder of the year. In support of these detailed plans, a variety of quality online and offline materials, resources, and supports have been quickly developed and put together for students, families, and teachers. We have already implemented Phases 1-3, with Phase 3 beginning this week. This week your child’s teachers began to provide information, resources and/or assignments to support the review and/or extension of the learning standards in all curriculum areas taught through March 13, 2020. It is important to note that the majority of standards students should master before moving to the next grade were a part of this instructional time period from August through mid-March.
Although, we are currently not grading this review learning, we have asked that teachers continue to provide specific growth-producing feedback to students. Additionally, the Superintendent of Schools has shared that students are also able to work with their teacher(s) to redo assignments and/or retake assessments given or assigned prior to March 13.
These detailed continuity of learning plans also include Phases 4-6 of our learning support that will result in increased virtual instruction and learning time between teachers and students, as well as a movement toward increasing numbers of students utilizing other remote online learning systems. These learning systems will be able to support both review and new learning. It is important to remember that our quick closure and rapidly increased remote learning bring challenges and we are working to mitigate challenges such as device and connectivity access for students and staff.
Parents and guardians are encouraged to visit the PWCS Home Learning Resources webpage for ideas and recommended schedules to keep students engaged in learning while at home.
FOOD SERVICE – PWCS will continue to provide to-go meals from 9–11 a.m. at locations across the County. USDA has created a waiver for parents to be allowed to collect meals without their children. However, we are awaiting guidance from VDOE before we can implement this practice locally. More details about meal service.
SCHOOL BOARD MEETING – the School Board will hold an emergency meeting next Wednesday, and the Superintendent of Schools will outline plans for the remainder of the school year in the following areas (details will be shared with all PWCS staff, students, parents, and guardians following the School Board meeting):
Grading: PWCS will present a plan that is fair and equitable, and will provide students the opportunity to graduate, progress to the next grade level, and raise grades. It is important to note the Virginia Department of Education does not recommend any new graded assignments be developed for the remainder of the year.
Instruction and Distance Learning: Beyond the grading of student work received on or prior to March 13, we are working on a detailed plan to conduct ongoing learning and enrichment through June 14. This plan will include use of a learning management system and enhancing technology access for students, as well as other forms of learning.
Graduations: The School Board will be updated on potential alternatives to High School Graduations.
Moving forward, PWCS will only provide updates when new, significant, Division-wide information is available.
March 25, 2020 Updates
New Information
NEW GUIDANCE FOR SENIORS - The Virginia Department of Education (VDOE) has issued new guidance regarding seniors planning to graduate this school year. Superintendent of Public Instruction James Lane announced that he is using his authority under Governor Ralph Northam’s Executive Order 51 (PDF) to ensure that high school seniors who were on track to earn a diploma later this spring are able to graduate.
High school seniors in the following categories will be able to graduate on time, despite the closure of schools for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year:
Seniors currently enrolled in a course for which they need a standard or verified credit in order to graduate (verified credits are earned by passing a required course and also passing the associated Standards of Learning test);
Seniors who have successfully completed a course required for graduation, but have not earned the associated verified credit; and
Seniors who have not passed a required student-selected SOL test;
Flexibility is also available for seniors who have not earned a required career and technical education credential, seniors who have not completed a fine or performing arts course or CTE course, seniors who were unable to complete sequential course requirements, and seniors who have not completed a course in economics and personal finance.
Action by the General Assembly is required for the waiver of requirements in the Code of Virginia for the following students, and VDOE anticipates that will occur in April:
Seniors who have not completed training in emergency first aid, cardiopulmonary resuscitation, and the use of automated external defibrillators; and
Seniors who have not completed a virtual course.
Based on VDOE guidance, PWCS staff are developing additional details for seniors, and all staff, regarding graduation requirements, grades, and assessments. Further updates will be provided as soon as possible.
KINDERGARTEN REGISTRATION - Prince William County Public Schools has opened online kindergarten registration for the 2020-21 school year. Find more kindergarten registration information here.
STUDENT LEARNING CONTINUES - Although our school buildings and grounds are closed, learning is open, and staff and teachers are working daily. Please visit the PWCS Home Learning Resources webpage for ideas on how to keep your student engaged in school while at home. PWCS is exploring opportunities for equitable distance learning while ensuring compliance with all federal and state requirements.
HUMAN RESOURCES UPDATE – A Frequently Asked Questions for employees webpage on many personnel questions is now available .
SOCIAL DISTANCING – Please remember that the Prince William County Parks and Recreation Department has closed playgrounds, and PWCS grounds, including fields, have been closed to Community use as well. Groups of 10 or more should not be using PWCS fields. Please remind your students. See CDC Guidelines for more information.
Moving forward, PWCS will only provide updates when new, significant, Division-wide information is available.
March 24, 2020

div.p: Prince William County Public Schools (PWCS) is providing the following update regarding changes caused by the COVID-19 shutdown. Please note PWCS staff members are working daily to coordinate key information and develop guidance based on new information. Your patience and support are appreciated during this extraordinary time.

ol.li: SCHOOL BUILDINGS CLOSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH JUNE – By order of the Governor of Virginia, all Prince William County Public Schools will remain closed to students through the end of the 2019-20 school year (June 2020), due to the health concerns caused by COVID-19 (coronavirus). Read More
SACC – School age child-care (SACC) is canceled through June 2020.

GRADUATIONS – all in-person graduation ceremonies and proms planned through June are canceled. PWCS will work to determine alternative ways, or future events, to safely celebrate the Class of 2020 (they’ve earned it!).
ACTIVITIES, SPORTS – all activities including sports are canceled through June 2020.
COMMUNITY USE AND FACILITIES – all community use at any PWCS facility is canceled through June 2020.

ACCESS TO BUILDINGS – all PWCS buildings remain closed to any visitor, except limited support staff per guidance sent last week. We recognize that students and staff would like access to the buildings to retrieve personal belongings and other items; however, the health and safety of all staff and students is the top priority and at this time PWCS cannot risk potential COVID-19 community spread through such activity.
FOOD SERVICE – PWCS will continue to provide to-go meals from 9–11 a.m. at locations across the County. More details.

IB TESTING – the International Baccalaureate (IB) May 2020 examinations for Diploma Program and Career-related Program candidates will no longer be held. Depending on what they registered for, the student will be awarded a Diploma or a Course Certificate which reflects their standard of work. This is based on student's coursework and the established assessment expertise, rigor, and quality control already built into the programs. PWCS IB Coordinators will share further details with students as available.

GRADES – students on track for graduation should still expect to graduate. PWCS expects guidance from the Virginia Department of Education (VDOE) this week regarding student credits. Once PWCS has this information, a further determination will be made regarding student grading for this year.

SPECIAL EDUCATION – PWCS is awaiting further state and federal guidance on providing special education services and conducting IEP meetings. Once clarification is received, PWCS will provide an update.
DISTANCE LEARNING - PWCS is exploring opportunities for equitable distance learning while ensuring compliance with all federal and state requirements.

HOME INSTRUCTION – details regarding expectations for optional at-home instruction during the current closure were sent to all PWCS staff and families last week. Visit the PWCS Home Learning Resources webpage for more information.
STAFF PAY – PWCS staff will be expected to continue to work remotely, and in limited cases within buildings, and will receive pay through the end of the school year as outlined in previous updates.
STAFF HR QUESTIONS – Guidance was sent to all staff Friday regarding some human resources (HR) related questions. Detailed HR FAQs will be posted online later this week.

div.h3: PWCS SCHOOL BUILDINGS CLOSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH THE END OF SCHOOL YEAR
div.p:
By order of the Governor of Virginia, all Prince William County Public Schools will remain closed to students through the end of the 2019-2020 school year (June 2020), due to the health concerns caused by COVID-19 (coronavirus).
The state will waive the days missed and will not require the days missed be made up.
Guidance is expected to come from the Virginia Department of Education (VDOE) later this week regarding graduation requirements, credits, and the impact of this decision on learning, including special education. The state is in the process of waiving Standards of Learning (SOL) this year. Once the waiver is received, we will provide an update. PWCS is also waiting on further guidance on other standard assessments and school accreditation.
PWCS will review this guidance, as well as information from the federal Department of Education, to determine the impact to PWCS and necessary changes. PWCS will share additional information on these topics, and other questions in the coming days, as soon as possible.
We know students, staff, and parents will have many questions and we thank you for your patience as we adjust to these changes as rapidly as possible.

br.p: Prince William County Public Schools (PWCS) is providing the following update and recap of key information regarding changes caused by the COVID-19 shutdown. Please note PWCS staff members are working daily to coordinate key information and develop guidance based on new information. Your patience and support are appreciated during this extraordinary time.

ol.li: HOME INSTRUCTION – details regarding expectations for optional at home instruction during the current closure were sent to all PWCS staff and families earlier today. Visit the PWCS Home Learning Resources page for more information.

AP EXAMS – The College Board announced today that traditional face-to-face exam administrations will not take place this school year. For the 2019–20 exam administration only, students can take a 45-minute online exam at home. PWCS is evaluating this guidance and will share more details on facilitating this once determined.

STANDARDIZED TESTING - The federal Department of Education today announced that students impacted by school closures due to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic can bypass standardized testing for the 2019-20 school year, once a state applies for a waiver. PWCS anticipates the Virginia Department of Education (VDOE) to seek waiving Standards of Learning this year. Further details will be provided in the next couple of weeks from the VDOE.
BUILDING ACCESS - Guidance was sent to all staff and families that all PWCS effective today are closed to all but limited support staff. More details.

WIFI ACCESS – PWCS is working to develop outdoor “WIFI Hotspots” at select locations. This will allow families who need to access to the Internet to social distance (such as sitting in car) and get online. The first location now available is the grounds of Fitzgerald Elementary School. More locations will be announced next week.
FOOD SERVICE – PWCS is continually evaluating the best means to provide to-go meals to students. Expanded hours and additional locations will be announced early next week.

STAFF HR QUESTIONS – Guidance was sent to all staff this evening, regarding some human resources (HR) related questions, please see your PWCS email for more information. Detailed HR FAQs will be posted online next week.

br.p: **Please note the next update will be Monday March 23, unless there is a need to share urgent information.

ul.li: PWCS works in close collaboration with the Prince William County Health Department and will ensure that the appropriate individuals are notified of the possibility of exposure to the virus. At this time, PWCS has received no directive to make any such notifications. If this changes, PWCS will alert families immediately. For more, please visit the Virginia Department of Health.
Food service to-go is available at various locations in PWCS: See complete details.

The College Board is canceling the May 2, 2020 SAT and SAT Subject Test administration. Makeup exams for the March 14 administration (scheduled for March 28) are also canceled. Visit College Board for more information.
Instructional and support staff should expect to be available remotely during standard work hours next week (March 23-27).
Prince William County Libraries are offering Curbside Pick Up. Place an order, then come to your branch to pick it up curbside. See complete details.
Spring Break will still occur as scheduled (April 6-10).
All Prince William County Public Schools are closed to students until April 14. This may be extended if necessary.
Community use of all PWCS facilities indoor and outdoor is canceled until further notice.

County officials have asked we remind all parents and guardians to instruct children to use social/physical distancing and not to gather in groups including playgrounds, playing fields, and playdates.
Teachers will not report in person until the planned teacher workday on April 13. This may be extended if necessary.
No PWCS employees should report until further notice (with the exception of designated staff to support critical functions who should report as directed).
All student work due dates have been extended until at least April 14.
The third quarter grading period will be extended until at least April 17; this may be extended as the situation evolves.
All full and part-time employees (on contracts or position assignments) will continue to be paid during the closure.

All active substitutes and temporary employees hired on or before February 13, 2020, will receive pay during the closure. In order to be considered active, a substitute or a temporary employee has to have worked between February 13, 2020, and March 13, 2020. You will be paid based on your average bimonthly earnings over the past six months. Those with less than six months employment will be paid based on their average bimonthly earnings over the period they have been employed with PWCS.
Please visit the CDC and Virginia Department of Health for more information regarding key health and social distancing information.
Those interested in donating money, supplies, and your time to help our students and families please visit the SPARK website.

STUDENT HEALTH – County officials have asked we remind all parents and guardians to instruct children to use social/physical distancing and not to gather in groups including playgrounds, playing fields, and playdates.

DONATIONS - We recognize that these are trying times and we are thankful that our PWCS community is sticking together. We know that many of you are interested in donating money, supplies, and your time to help our students and families. For more information on donations, go to our SPARK website.

HOME INTERNET - for those reading this email (such as via phone) who would like to expand your access to the internet at home:
a. Comcast: is offering 60 days of complimentary Internet Essentials service. To sign up, applicants can simply visit the Comcast Internet Essentials website. The accessible website also includes the option to video chat with customer service agents in American Sign Language. There are also two dedicated phone numbers: 1-855-846-8376 for English and 1-855-765-6995 for Spanish.
b. Cox: Connect2Complete Service. Until May 15, 2020, they are providing phone and remote desktop support through Cox Complete Care at no charge to provide peace of mind and ease for technology needs. Resources for discounted, refurbished equipment through our association with PCs for People. Visit the Cox website.

Update March 17, 2020

ol.li: Two additional food distribution sites have been added — Coles and Yorkshire Elementary Schools. See complete details.

Spring Break will still occur as scheduled (April 6-10).

The Virginia state superintendent announced today that the Virginia Department of Education (VDOE) will seek relief from federal and state requirements related to state required testing (Standards of Learning SOLs). PWCS will provide any updates as available.

The state superintendent has also directed VDOE staff to review state laws and regulations related to state graduation requirements to determine what steps must be taken to ensure that seniors who would otherwise graduate this spring are not denied diplomas. PWCS will provide any updates as available.

Human Resources and the Finance Office are working remotely and answers to frequently asked questions (FAQ) regarding payroll, benefits, hiring, and licensure are being developed and will be shared this week.

hr.p: PWCS is providing the following updates March 16, 2020, regarding changes caused by the COVID-19 shutdown:

ol.li: Staff and students are asked to focus on themselves and their families this week (March 16 – March 22).
In response to the Governor’s direction, all new instruction will be suspended for the next two weeks.
New student work must not be assigned until at least March 27.
All student work due dates have been extended until at least April 14.
The only exception will be students participating in dual enrollment courses, who will follow the expectations communicated by the colleges and universities that provide their course.
The third quarter grading period will be extended until at least April 17; this may be extended as the situation evolves.
Teachers will not report in person until the planned teacher workday on April 13. This may be extended if necessary.
Details for the expectations for staff and teachers working virtually starting March 23 will be provided later this week.
All full and part-time employees (on contracts or position assignments) will continue to be paid during the closure.

All active substitutes and temporary employees hired on or before February 13, 2020, will receive pay during the closure. In order to be considered active, a substitute or a temporary employee has to have worked between February 13, 2020, and March 13, 2020. You will be paid based on your average bimonthly earnings over the past six months. Those with less than six months employment will be paid based on their average bimonthly earnings over the period they have been employed with PWCS.
No PWCS employees should report until further notice (with the exception of designated staff to support critical functions who should report as directed).
Information for essential medications pick-up and food service pick-up locations can be found at www.pwcs.edu.

hr.p: Parents/Guardians,

We realize that some students may have needed medications in our school clinics. Prince William County Public Schools (PWCS) will be opening up each of our school buildings on Tuesday, March 17, from 4:30-7:30 p.m. for pick-up for those medications that students will need in the next few weeks. Please note that this is not an end-of-year medication pick up; rather it is a pick up for those essential medications that students need between now and April 14. Our school nurses and administrators will be on hand for parents to retrieve their student’s medication. We ask that you come to the school during this time with your photo ID and a personal pen to sign the Prince William County Schools Authorization for Medication Administration form to retrieve student medication. Parents/guardians and students will not have access to any parts of our school buildings with the exception of area where the school nurse and administrator will be stationed. Here are some guidelines for the medication check-out:

ol.li: Parents/guardians will need to report to the main entrance of the school. Depending on the location of the clinic in the school building, you may see a sign directing you to report to another door.
In order to ensure that we have your medication ready for pick up, we ask that you use the online form to share your intent to pick up student medication.
Please remember to bring a photo ID and your own pen to sign the form.

Parents will be asked to wait outside the building at the designated entrance and will be invited in one at a time to pick up their student medication. We will ask those waiting in line to comply with social distancing and safety protocols.

hr.p: Thank you for your patience during this unprecedented school closure.

ol.li: All School-Age Child Care (SACC) is closed until further notice.

No PWCS employees should report until further notice (with the exception of designated food service employees, custodians, and designated staff to support critical business who should report as directed).
PWCS will provide further details for staff reporting later this week.
Packaged breakfasts and lunches will be provided to-go at select locations throughout the county, to anyone under the age of 18. View school sites and times for to-go meals.
All activities and community use are canceled until further notice.

Per the Governor’s order related to the state of emergency, the state will waive the school hours missed during the Governor’s order covering the closure until at least March 27. Beyond this time, PWCS will continue to have 13.5 days of emergency hours “snow-days” to utilize if necessary to cover school closing.

Teachers do not need to be assigning work to students this week. Due to the waivers provided by the Governor’s office, at this time, schools do not need to consider strategies for continuity of learning to count as an official instructional day.

PWCS will provide updates later this week regarding additional resources for families to support student independent learning at home and expectations for staff to support this learning beyond this week.

The Virginia Department of Education is evaluating options to provide flexibility in meeting testing requirements for the Standards of Learning tests, the Virginia Alternate Assessment Program and the ACCESS for ELs test administered to English Learners. More information and guidance will be provided as it becomes available.

This is an evolving situation that is changing rapidly. PWCS will continue to make every effort to provide updates on a daily basis as needed, to answer the many important questions we are receiving from staff and families.

hr.p: Thank you for your patience and understanding.

hr.h3: PWCS Closed to Students Until April 14
hr.p: All Prince William County Public Schools will close to students effective Saturday, March 14, until April 14, due to the growing health concern caused by COVID-19 (coronavirus). This closure may be extended depending on the situation.
Additional details:

ul.li: All SACC will be closed from March 16 onward.
Packaged breakfasts and lunches will be provided to-go at select locations throughout the county, to anyone under the age of 18. School sites and times for to-go meals.
The only employees who will report March 14 -17 will be the Superintendent, the Deputy Superintendent, the Associate Superintendents, and custodians as directed.
Designated food service employees and custodians will report during the closure at select locations as scheduled.
No other PWCS employees should report until further notice.
Decisions on instruction and employees reporting to work beyond March 16-20 will be sent next week.
All full and part-time employees will continue to be paid during the closure.
For student safety, the SATs planned for this weekend have been canceled, students should contact the College Board for more information.
All activities and community use are canceled until further notice.

hr.p: Dear PWCS Parents, Guardians, and Staff,

Prince William County Public Schools (PWCS) places the safety and health of all our families and staff as our highest priority. The COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic has been rapidly evolving and we have been closely monitoring the situation. Today, a number of significant developments have occurred that have provided us new information, including the Governor’s declaration of a state of emergency.

Recognizing any changes to school operations have significant impacts on students, I am announcing a number of actions only after serious and considerable deliberation with stakeholders across the County. Our goal is to continue to provide instruction in a safe and effective manner. At this time there is no known direct case of COVID-19 within any PWCS school.
The following are changes I have directed today:

ul.li: Effective Friday, March 13, 2020 - All students should continue to attend school on Friday, March 13. Parents can choose to keep students home and the absence will be excused. All extracurricular activities outside of the regular school day are canceled until further notice. This includes before and after-school activities, and community use of buildings and grounds. All field trips, out-of-state trips, team practices, club meetings, interscholastic contests and athletic contests, both home and away, are canceled until further notice. School Age Child Care will continue as regularly scheduled.
Saturday, March 14, 2020 -The SATs will continue as planned with appropriate health precautions in place.

Monday, March 16, 2020, will be a teacher and staff workday. This will allow administrators and teachers to collaborate and prepare to ensure continuity of instruction should PWCS need to close for an extended period. Students will not report to school. School Age Child Care (SACC) will operate an all-day program 6 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. that includes breakfast, lunch and snack.

Tuesday, March 17, 2020, is a virtual workday, with the exception of essential personnel. Students will not report. School Age Child Care (SACC) will operate an all-day program 6 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. that includes breakfast, lunch and snack.
Students will return to school on Wednesday, March 18, 2020. PWCS will continuously monitor updates regarding COVID-19 and will communicate updates as needed.

hr.p: These closures will also allow an opportunity for additional disinfection of schools and buses.
We continue to value your support as we work together to help support all children, their families, and our staff through this challenging situation. Additional FAQs .
We are continually monitoring this situation and will make updates as necessary.

Sincerely,
Steve Walts
Superintendent of Schools

div.p: Prince William County Public Schools is aware of multiple closings and cancellations in the area. Our Pandemic Team has been meeting everyday and is currently meeting to determine next steps. Health Department guidance has not changed. However, all information is being considered and if a decision is made to change school operations, we will share that information through the same channels used to communicate weather closings. A complete update will be made by this evening.

br.p: Dear PWCS Parents, Guardians, and Staff,

Prince William County Public Schools (PWCS) is aware of the recent announcements that Virginia has two presumptive positive cases of COVID-19 (coronavirus). PWCS places the safety of our students and staff as our highest priority and is closely monitoring this situation. PWCS will continue to the follow the guidance of local, state, and national health agencies. The Prince William Health District is coordinating its response with the Virginia Department of Health (VDH), the Governor of Virginia, and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

According to health officials, there are no signs of the virus spreading in Virginia. For the general American public, who are unlikely to be exposed to this virus at this time, the immediate health risk from COVID-19 is still considered low.

As the risk remains low, at this time, PWCS does not plan any changes to operating status of schools or events. However, should this change, PWCS is prepared to make adjustments as necessary. It is important that school staff and adults provide reassurance to students during this period of uncertainty. In order to support this, lesson plans and resources are being provided to schools via school counselors. For more information on PWCS preparedness, and tips for communicating with children, please refer to the detailed answers available in the Frequently Asked Questions.

PWCS continues to encourage students and staff to practice healthy behaviors (for example, staying home when students or staff are sick, covering coughs and sneezes, and washing hands often). PWCS works with schools to ensure proper supplies are on hand for school cleaning and that school custodians are cleaning frequently touched surfaces. If you or your student is sick, please contact your health care provider.
Please visit the Virginia Department of Health (VDH) and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) for additional information.
Thank you for your ongoing support of PWCS.

hr.p: Dear PWCS families and staff,

We recognize that recent national news regarding the COVID-19 (coronavirus) may be confusing and worrying. Please know that Prince William County Public Schools (PWCS) has been closely monitoring this situation for the past few weeks and stands ready to implement any specific guidance received by local or national health officials. PWCS has not received any new guidance beyond what we have shared in previous communications.

While we do not have any information regarding a specific risk to Prince William County, out of an abundance of caution, PWCS recommends families and staff begin planning for a potential disruption to school operations. This preparation is recommended to be similar to a “Code Red” weather event that may emerge without the ability for much prior notification, and without knowing the timing or duration in advance. It is also possible that no such disruption occurs. Just as in a weather-closing, families should consider child-care plans in the event both schools and school age child-care are impacted.

As we remain in the height of flu-season, PWCS continues to encourage students and staff to practice healthy behaviors (for example, staying home when students or staff are sick, covering coughs and sneezes, and washing hands often). PWCS works with schools to ensure proper supplies are on hand for school cleaning and that school custodians are cleaning frequently touched surfaces. If you or your student is sick, please contact your health care provider.

At this time, the School Division does not have any overseas trips planned to countries impacted by the virus outbreak. However, we continue to closely monitor this evolving situation and the possibility for cancellation of planned travel exists.

It is important to note this virus does not discriminate based on nationality or ethnicity. We are proud of our diverse School Division and community, and we are certain that everyone will continue to support one another during this period of uncertainty. As always, we expect our students and staff to provide a welcoming environment for every student, family, and staff member.

PWCS has a collaborative working team that is updating detailed plans for operational and instructional support should this virus impact PWCS. We will continue to communicate updates on a regular basis as needed.
Please visit the Virginia Department of Health (VDH) and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) for additional information.
Thank you for your ongoing support of PWCS.

br.p: The Virginia Department of Health (VDH) is monitoring an outbreak of respiratory illness, called coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by a novel (new) coronavirus that was first detected in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

Cases of COVID-19 are also being reported in a growing number of countries internationally, including the United States, where the first case of COVID-19 was confirmed on January 21, 2020, in a traveler who had recently returned from Wuhan.

No cases have been confirmed in Virginia at this time. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has not yet released guidance specifically for K-12 school settings, but staff, students, and parents seeking general information may visit the VDH and CDC websites for the most current information.

PWCS staff are closely monitoring the situation and a collaborative working group is developing specific plans in the event any changes to school operations are required. Additional guidance will be provided as developed and as necessary.
All PWCS families are encouraged to continue the practice of maintaining healthy behaviors necessary during any cold and flu season. These include but are not limited to:

ul.li: Wash hands frequently with soap and water. Use an alcohol-based hand cleaner if soap and water are not available.
Cover nose and mouth with a sleeve or a tissue when coughing or sneezing.
Avoid touching eyes, nose, and mouth to prevent the spread of germs.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched surfaces and objects, such as toys and doorknobs, especially if someone is sick.

br.p: If you would like further information, please contact your healthcare provider or refer to the Virginia Department of Health and Centers for Disease Control and Prevention websites.

Dear PWCS Parent or Guardian:
The wellness and health of PWCS students is of the utmost importance at this time of year. The Virginia Department of Health is closely monitoring an outbreak of respiratory illness caused by a novel (new) coronavirus (termed “2019-nCoV”). Please be assured that PWCS Student Health Services staff continue to monitor illness in our schools as a standard practice. As always, we will share additional information with school communities as needed.
We urge all PWCS families to continue the practice of maintaining healthy behaviors necessary during any cold and flu season. These include but are not limited to:

ul.li: Wash hands frequently with soap and water. Use an alcohol-based hand cleaner if soap and water are not available.
Cover nose and mouth with a sleeve or a tissue when coughing or sneezing.
Avoid touching eyes, nose, and mouth to prevent the spread of germs.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched surfaces and objects, such as toys and doorknobs, especially if someone is sick.
Stay home when you are sick.

br.p: If you would like further information, please contact your healthcare provider or refer to the Virginia Department of Health and Centers for Disease Controls and Prevention websites.
We appreciate your support and cooperation as we work together to ensure a safe and healthy environment for our students and staff.

Sincerely,
Teresa Polk
Supervisor of School Health Services

Latest Update

Actualización del 3 de abril del 2020 

NUEVA INFORMACIÓN

    
DESCANSO DE PRIMAVERA – Del 6 al 10 de abril, son las vacaciones de primavera. PWCS honrarán las vacaciones de primavera para los empleados y sus familias como estaba previsto. Por favor sepan que la mayoría del personal estará de vacaciones la próxima semana como estaba previsto y no se espera que responda a correos electrónicos u otras comunicaciones durante este tiempo. Los Servicios de Alimentos y Nutrición continuarán sirviendo comidas durante las vacaciones de primavera. El 13 de abril continuará siendo un día de trabajo de maestros planificado con los maestros trabajando a distancia.
    
 
    
    
REUNIÓN DE LA JUNTA ESCOLAR - La Junta Escolar del Condado de Prince William se reunió el miércoles, 1 de abril para escuchar una presentación del Dr. Steve Walts, Superintendente de las escuelas, sobre la respuesta de la División a la pandemia. Puede ver la reunión de la Junta Escolar cumplir aquí . Lo más destacado del Dr. Walts con respecto al Plan de Aprendizaje incluye:
    
        
Mi más alta prioridad sigue siendo la salud física y mental de los estudiantes y el personal.
        
Simplemente no es justo, ni realista, esperar que nuestros maestros, estudiantes y administradores - o familias - puedan replicar el día escolar en casa.
        
Quiero que nuestros maestros sepan, que nuestros estudiantes sepan, y que nuestro personal sepa - que está bien.
        
Estamos todos juntos en esto - vamos a trabajar juntos para hacer lo mejor que podamos para apoyar el uno al otro - y eso es lo importante.
        
Teniendo en cuenta este tiempo notable en el que estamos - es mi expectativa que proporcionemos a los estudiantes mayor libertad y gracia tanto como sea posible.
        
De acuerdo con la orientación del Departamento de Educación de Virginia, las calificaciones de los estudiantes sólo podrán mejorar desde donde estaban el 13 de marzo.
        
 
        
    
    
    
CONTINUIDAD DEL APRENDIZAJE - PWCS ha dado a conocer los detalles de la Fase 4 de la Continuidad del Plan de aprendizaje * para todos los estudiantes, que comenzará 14 de abril después de las vacaciones de primavera y del día de trabajo de maestros. Este plan proporciona una dirección más específica en la Escuela Virtual desde Casa y cómo navegar con éxito el aprendizaje virtual. Además, esta cronología de tiempo proporciona más información sobre todas las seis fases de toda la continuidad del Plan de Aprendizaje. Se les pide a las familias para que den tiempo a líderes de las escuelas de trabajar con sus profesores después de las vacaciones de primavera, y durante la jornada del trabajo de maestros, antes de ponerse en contacto con preguntas para los profesores o la escuela.
    
 
    
    
RECURSOS DE EDUCACIÓN ESPECIAL - Más recursos han sido publicados para prestar apoyo a los estudiantes con necesidades especiales y a sus familias.
    
 
    
    
INFORMACIÓN DE RECOGIDA DE COMIDA PARA LLEVAR- USDA ha creado una exención a los padres para permitir que recojan las comidas con sus hijos. Las comidas siguen estando disponibles durante las vacaciones de primavera. PWCS ha ampliado servicio de recogida de comidas a tres sitios escolares más a partir del 6 de abril, incluyendo Escuela Primaria Potomac View, Escuela Primaria River Oaks y la Escuela Intermedia Saunders. Más información detallada se puede encontrar aquí.
    
 
    
    
ACCESO A COMPUTADORAS- Como se ha señalado en las declaraciones Dr. Walts (ver # 2 arriba), los padres y tutores de los estudiantes de secundaria deben estar alerta de una encuesta telefónica que se enviará la próxima semana para evaluar las necesidades de los estudiantes que no puedan no tener una computadora en casa. Las encuestas para grados adicionales serán programadas a finales de este mes.


 

Actualizaciones anteriores y mayor información está disponible en línea.

*Debido a los retos relacionados con este evento histórico de salud mundial y la emergencia nacional; será necesario que nuestros equipos se adapten a una nueva manera de apoyar a nuestros estudiantes. Como resultado de la orden del Gobernador Northam, las escuelas de PWCS deben permanecer cerradas por el resto del año escolar. Mientras garantizamos la seguridad y el bienestar de los estudiantes, PWCS no puede continuar ofreciendo a sus estudiantes un día de instrucción y servicios delineados en los IEPs, planes de 504, planes de estudiantes de alta capacidad académica, y servicios requeridos para estudiantes de EL de la misma manera que como se ofrecían cuando las escuelas estaban abiertas. En lugar de la instrucción, nuestras escuelas y miembros de equipos están implementando el siguiente plan para proveer a los estudiantes con oportunidades para aprender, para desafiarse a si mismos, y para revisar y retener lecciones pasadas. Todas las maestras trabajaran colaborando y usando estrategias proactivas para continuar involucrando en la enseñanza a todos los alumnos, incluyendo a nuestros estudiantes aprendices del idioma inglés, de educación especial, doblemente identificados y estudiantes doblemente excepcionales proporcionándoles los apoyos posibles teniendo en cuenta las limitaciones del aprendizaje virtual bajo estas condiciones.

Latest Update

Trường Công lập Quận Prince William (PWCS) đang cung cấp thông tin cập nhật sau đây liên quan đến những thay đổi do phong tỏa vì COVID-19. Xin lưu ý rằng các nhân viên PWCS đang nỗ lực hàng ngày để phối hợp thông tin chính và phát triển hướng dẫn dựa trên thông tin mới. Chúng tôi rất cám ơn sự kiên nhẫn và hỗ trợ của bạn trong thời gian đặc biệt này.

Cập nhật ngày 3 tháng 4 năm 2020

THÔNG TIN MỚI - 

    
NGHỈ XUÂN - Ngày 6-10 tháng 4, là kì nghỉ xuân. PWCS sẽ thực hiện Kỳ nghỉ xuân cho nhân viên và gia đình theo kế hoạch. Xin lưu ý rằng hầu hết các nhân viên sẽ nghỉ vào tuần tới theo lịch và sẽ không trả lời email hoặc thông tin liên hệ khác trong khi nghỉ phép. Bộ phận Dịch vụ Thực phẩm và Dinh dưỡng học đường sẽ tiếp tục phục vụ các bữa ăn trong thời gian nghỉ Xuân. Ngày 13 tháng 4 sẽ tiếp tục là Ngày làm việc của giáo viên theo kế hoạch với các giáo viên làm việc từ xa.  
    
HỌP HỘI ĐỒNG NHÀ TRƯỜNG - Hội đồng trường Quận Prince William đã họp vào thứ Tư, ngày 1 tháng 4, để nghe thuyết trình bởi Tiến sĩ Steve Walts, Tổng Giám đốc Học khu, về ứng phó của Học khu đối với đại dịch. Bạn có thể xem cuộc họp của Hội đồng nhà trường tại đây. Những thông tin nổi bật từ Tiến sĩ Walts về Kế hoạch học tập bao gồm:  
    
        
Ưu tiên cao nhất của tôi vẫn là sức khỏe thể chất và tinh thần của học sinh và nhân viên. Thật không công bằng, cũng không thực tế, khi kỳ vọng các giáo viên, học sinh và quản trị viên của chúng ta - hoặc gia đình - bắt chước ngày học ở trường tại nhà.
        
Tôi muốn các giáo viên biết, học sinh biết và nhân viên biết là - không sao cả.
        
Tất cả chúng ta đều chung sức cùng nhau - chúng ta sẽ phối hợp cùng nhau để làm tốt nhất có thể để hỗ trợ lẫn nhau - và đó là điều quan trọng.
        
Trong khoang thời gian chưa từng có này - tôi mong muốn chúng ta đem đến cho học sinh nhiều sự độc lập và cân bằng nhất có thể tốt.
        
Phù hợp với hướng dẫn của Sở Giáo dục Virginia, điểm số của học sinh sẽ chỉ có thể đi lên từ nơi họ đã ở vào ngày 13 tháng 3.  
    
    
    
TIẾP TỤC HỌC TẬP - PWCS đã công bố chi tiết về Giai đoạn 4 của Kế hoạch Học tập Liên tục* dành cho tất cả học sinh, sẽ bắt đầu vào ngày 14 tháng 4 sau kỳ nghỉ xuân và ngày làm việc của giáo viên. Kế hoạch này đưa ra hướng cụ thể hơn về Ngôi trường ảo và cách điều hướng học tập thành công. Ngoài ra, mốc thời gian này cung cấp thêm thông tin về tất cả sáu giai đoạn của toàn bộ Kế hoạch Học tập Liên tục. Các gia đình được yêu cầu dành thời gian cho các nhà lãnh đạo của trường chúng ta làm việc với giáo viên sau kì nghỉ xuân và Ngày làm việc của giáo viên, trước khi liên hệ với giáo viên hoặc trường học của họ để đặt câu hỏi.  
    
NGUỒN LỰC GIÁO DỤC ĐẶC BIỆT - các nguồn lực bổ sung đã được công bố để cung cấp hỗ trợ cho học sinh có nhu cầu đặc biệt và gia đình của trẻ.  
    
THÔNG TIN ĐẾN NHẬN SUẤT ĂN - USDA đã tạo ra quy định miễn trừ để cha mẹ được phép đến nhận suất ăn với con cái của mình. Các suất ăn sẽ tiếp tục được cung cấp trong thời gian nghỉ xuân. PWCS đã mở rộng việc nhận suất ăn đến ba địa điểm trường khác bắt đầu từ ngày 6 tháng Tư, bao gồm Trường tiểu học Potomac View, Trường tiểu học River Oaks và Trường trung học Saunders. Thông tin chi tiết có thể xem tại đây.  
    
TRUY CẬP MÁY TÍNH - Như đã nêu trong nhận xét của Tiến sĩ Walts (xem #2 ở trên), phụ huynh và người giám hộ của học sinh trung học cần biết về một cuộc khảo sát qua điện thoại vào tuần tới để đánh giá nhu cầu của những học sinh có thể không có máy tính ở nhà. Khảo sát các cấp lớp bổ sung sẽ được lên kế hoạch vào cuối tháng này.


Thông tin cập nhật trước đây và thông tin bổ sung có trực tuyến.

*Do những thách thức liên quan đến sự kiện y tế thế giới lịch sử này và tình trạng khẩn cấp quốc gia; các đội của chúng tôi sẽ thích nghi với cách chúng tôi hỗ trợ sinh viên của mình. Do lệnh của Thống đốc Northam, các trường PWCS phải đóng cửa trong khoảng thời gian còn lại của năm học.  Trong khi chúng tôi đảm bảo sự an toàn và sức khỏe của học sinh, PWCS không còn có thể cung cấp cho học sinh ngày giảng dạy và các dịch vụ trong các IEP, kế hoạch 504, kế hoạch giáo dục năng khiếu và các dịch vụ EL được yêu cầu như khi các trường mở cửa để giảng dạy. Thay vì giảng dạy, các trường và đội ngũ nhân viên của chúng tôi đang thực hiện kế hoạch sau đây để đem đến cho học sinh cơ hội để học tập, thử thách bản thân và xem lại và giữ lại các bài học trong quá khứ. Tất cả các giáo viên sẽ hợp tác và sử dụng các chiến lược chủ động để tiếp tục thu hút sự tham gia học tập của tất cả học sinh bao gồm học sinh học tiếng Anh, giáo dục đặc biệt, được xác định tham gia cả hai chương trình và học sinh năng khiếu hai đặc tính (twice exceptional students) cung cấp các hỗ trợ có thể có do những hạn chế của hoạt động học tập ảo trong những điều kiện này.

Latest Update

Prince William 카운티 공립학교(PWCS)는 COVID-19 폐쇄조치에 따른 변경사항과 관련하여 다음과 같이 업데이트를 드립니다. PWCS 직원들은 중요한 정보를 조정하고 새로운 정보를 토대로 지침을 만들기 위해 매일 업무를 하고 있다는 점을 참고해 주시기 바랍니다. 지금과 같은 비상시기에 여러분들이 보여주시는 인내와 지원에 감사드립니다.

2020년 4월 3일 업데이트

새로운 정보 - 

    
봄방학 - 4월 6~10일은 봄방학입니다. PWCS는 직원들과 가족들이 계획대로 봄방학을 보내도록 할 것입니다. 대부분의 직원들은 다음 주에 예정대로 휴무 상태에 있을 것이며 휴가 중 이메일이나 다른 교신에 응대하지 않을 것으로 생각해 주시기 바랍니다. 봄방학 동안 학교 식품영양 서비스(Food and Nutrition Services)는 계속해서 식사를 제공할 것입니다. 4월 13일 교사들은 원격 근무 형태로 예정된 교사 근무일을 계속해서 실시합니다.  
    
학교 이사회 회의 - Prince William 카운티 학교 이사회는 수요일, 4월 1일에 모임을 가지고, 바이러스 대유행에 대한 부처의 대응에 대하여 Dr. Steve Walts 총장님의 발표를 들었습니다. 학교 이사회 회의는 이곳에서 보실 수 있습니다. 학습 계획에 대한 Dr. Walts의 요지는 다음과 같습니다:  
    
        
저의 최우선 순위는 여전히 학생과 직원들의 신체적 및 정신적 건강입니다. 우리 교사, 학생, 직원들(또는 가족들)에게 학교에서 하는 것과 같은 형태를 가정에서 그대로 진행하기를 기대하는 것은 그저 타당하지도 않을 뿐더러 현실적이지도 않습니다.
        
저는 우리 교사들이, 우리 학생들이, 그리고 우리 직원들이 이 점을 알아주었으면 합니다 - 괜찮습니다.
        
우리는 모두 한 배를 탔으며, 서로를 돕기 위해 함께 최선의 노력을 다 할 것이고, 이것이 실제 중요한 부분입니다.
        
우리가 현재 처해있는 이 특수한 시기를 감안할 때, 제가 기대하는 바는 학생들에게 할 수 있는 최대한 운신의 폭과 유예기간을 주는 것입니다.
        
버지니아주 교육부 지침에 따라, 학생들의 성적은 3월 13일자로 받은 것 이상으로만 줄 수 있습니다.  
    
    
    
학습의 지속 - PWCS는 학습 지속 계획* 제4단계에 대한 세부 내용을 발표했으며, 이는 모든 학생들을 대상으로 봄방학과 교사 근무일 이후 4월 14일부터 시작될 것입니다. 이 계획은 가상 재택학교에 대하여 더 구체적인 안내와 함께 가상 학습을 성공적으로 실시하기 위한 방법을 담고 있습니다. 또한, 이 일정표에는 학습 지속 계획 전반에 걸친 모든 6개 단계에 대한 추가 정보가 제시되어 있습니다. 선생님들이나 학교에 질문차 연락하시기 전에, 봄방학과 교사 근무일 후 학교 지도부가 선생님들과 이에 대비할 수 있도록 시간을 주실 것을 가족여러분들께 부탁드립니다.  
    
특수 교육 자료 - 특별한 도움이 필요한 학생과 그 가족을 지원하기 위하여 추가 자료를 게시하였습니다.  
    
식사 픽업 정보 - USDA는 자녀를 위해 식사 픽업을 허용하는 면제조항을 만들었습니다. 봄방학 동안 학교 식사는 계속 제공될 것입니다. PWCS는 4월 6일부터 Potomac View 초등학교, River Oaks 초등학교, Saunders 중학교 등 3개 학교를 추가하여 식사 픽업 장소를 확대했습니다. 더 상세한 내용은 이곳에서 확인하실 수 있습니다.  
    
컴퓨터 확보 - Dr. Walts의 발표에서 언급한 바와 같이(위의 #2항 참조), 고등학생의 부모 및 보호자는 가정에 컴퓨터를 가지고 있지 않을 수 있는 학생의 수요를 파악하기 위한 전화 설문 조사가 다음주에 실시된다는 점을 기억해 주시기 바랍니다. 다른 학년을 대상으로 하는 설문은 이달 후에 일정을 잡게 될 것입니다.


이전의 업데이트 및 추가 정보는 온라인에서 확인 가능합니다.

*역대급의 세계적 보건 상황 및 국가적 위기 상황에 따른 어려움으로 인해, 저희 팀은 학생들 지원 방식을 이에 맞추는 것이 필요합니다. 주지사 Northam의 행정명령에 따라, PWCS 학교는 남은 학사연도 기간 동안 비등교 상태를 유지해야 합니다.   학생들의 안전과 복지를 보장하기 위해, PWCS는 IEPs, 504 계획, 영재교육 계획, 필수 EL 봉사에서 규정하고 있는 의무 수업일 및 봉사를 더 이상 학교를 등교하는 상황에서 적용하는 것과 같이 학생들에게 적용할 수 없습니다. 수업을 실시하는 데에 있어, 저희 학교들과 팀원들은 다음의 계획을 시행함으로써 학생들에게 학습하고, 스스로에게 도전의 기회를 주며, 과거 학습 내용을 복습하고 유지할 수 있는 기회를 제공할 것입니다. 모든 교사들은 협력하고 전향적인 전략을 통해 현재 상황에서 진행되는 가상 학습의 한계를 감안하여 가능한 지원을 제공함으로써, 영어 학습자, 특수 교육 대상, 이중 교육(dually identified) 대상, 특수 영재(twice exceptional) 학생들을 포함한 모든 학생들이 지속적으로 배움을 이어나갈 수 있도록 할 것입니다.

Latest Updates

مدارس عمومی کانتی Prince William (PWCS) بروزرسانی زیر را درباره تغییرات ایجادشده بخاطر تعطیلات COVID-19 ارائه می‌کند. لطفاً توجه کنید  کارمندان PWCS  بصورت روزانه در تلاش هستند تا اطلاعات اصلی را هماهنگ کنند و بر اساس اطلاعات جدید راهنمای مناسبی را ترتیب دهند. صبر و پشتیبانی شما در این زمان  فوق العاده  قابل تقدیر است.

بروزرسانی‌های 3 آوریل، 2020 

اطلاعات جدید – 

    
تعطیلات بهار - 6 تا 10 آوریل تعطیلات بهار است. PWCS تعطیلات بهار را مطابق برنامه به کارمندان و خانواده‌ها هدیه می‌دهد. لطفاً بدانید که بیشتر کارمندان مطابق برنامه هفته آینده مرخصی هستند و در اوقات مرخصی، به ایمیل‌ها یا سایر ارتباطات پاسخی نخواهند داد. خدمات غذا و تغذیه مدرسه در طول تعطیلات بهار همچنان غذا خواهد داد. 13 آوریل روز کاری معلمان که باید از راه دور کار خود را انجام دهند. 
    
جلسه انجمن‌ نظارت‌ بر مدرسه‌ - انجمن‌ نظارت‌ بر مدرسۀ Prince William County روز چهارشنبه، 1 آوریل برای شنیدن سخنرانی  دکتر استیو والتز، سرپرست مدارس درباره واکنش بخش به همه‌گیری این بیماری برگزار شد. جلسه انجمن مدرسه را می‌توانید  اینجا مشاهده کنید. نکات مهم دکتر والتز درباره برنامه یادگیری شامل: 
    
        
مهمترین اولویت من سلامت جسمانی و روانی دانش آموزان و کارمندان است. اصلاً منصفانه و واقع گرایانه نیست که از معلمان، دانش آموزان و مدیران - یا خانواده ها - انتظار داشته باشیم که روزهای تحصیلی را در خانه بازسازی کنند. 
    
    
        
من دوست دارم معلمان ما، دانش آموزان و کارمندان ما بدانند که همه چیز خوب است.
    
    
        
ما در این مشکل همه با هم هستیم - با هم همکاری و بیشترین تلاشمان را خواهیم کرد تا بتوانیم از یکدیگر پشتیبانی کنیم و همین مسئله مهم است.
    
    
        
با توجه به این دوران فوق‌ العاده انتظار دارم که تا جای ممکن تسامح و فرصت به دانش آموزان ارائه بکنیم.
    
    
        
مطابق رهنمود Virginia Department of Education، نمرات دانش آموزان تنها از سطح خودشان در 13 مارس قابل افزایش است.

         
    
    
    
تداوم یادگیری – PWCS جزییات  مرحله 4 برنامه تداوم یادگیری تمام دانش آموزان را منتشر کرده که از 14 آوریل بعد از تعطیلات بهار و روز کاری معلم آغاز خواهد شد. این برنامه رهنمود خاص‌تری درباره خانه مدرسه مجازی و کندوکار موفقیت آمیز و مجازی یادگیری ارائه می‌دهد. همچنین،  برنامه زمانی اطلاعات بیشتری درباره تمام شش مرحله برنامه کامل تداوم یادگیری ارائه می‌کند. از خانواده‌ها خواسته می‌شود به مدیران مدرسه زمان بدهند تا بتوانند بعد از تعطیلات بهار و روز کاری معلم و قبل از پرسیدن سؤالات خود از معلمان یا مدرسه، با معلمان خود همکاری کنند. 
    
منابع خاص آموزشی – بیشتر منابعبرای ارائه پشتیبانی از دانش آموزان دارای نیازهای خاص و خانواده‌های آنها ارسال شده است. 
    
اطلاعات تحویل گرفتن غذا – USDA انصرافی را برای والدینی فراهم کرده تا بتوانند وعده‌های غذایی کودکان خود را بعداً یکجا تهیه کنند. وعده‌های غذایی در طول تعطیلات بهار نیز ارائه خواهند شد. PWCS تحویل وعده‌های غذایی را از 6 آوریل در سه مدرسه دیگر از جمله مدرسه ابتدایی Potomac View، مدرسه ابتدایی River Oaks و مدرسه راهنمایی Saunders گسترش داده است. اطلاعات دقیق‌تر در  اینجا موجود است. 
    
دسترسی به رایانه – همانطور که در بیانات دکتر والتز اشاره شد (#2 بالا را مشاهده کنید)، والدین و سرپرستان دانش آموزان دبیرستانی باید از پرسشنامه تلفنی هفته آینده آگاه باشند تا بتوانند نیازهای دانش آموزانی در خانه رایانه ندارند را ارزیابی کنند. پرسشنامه‌های سطوح کلاسی دیگر روزهای بعد همین ماه برنامه ریزی خواهد شد.


بروزرسانی‌های قبلی و اطلاعات بیشتر بصورت  آنلاین در دسترس هستند.

*بخاطر چالش‌های مربوط به این رویداد بهداشتی و تاریخی جهانی و وضعیت اضطراری ملی، تیم ما باید نحوۀ پشتیبانی از دانش آموزان‌مان را با شرایط تطبیق بدهد. در نتیجه دستور فرماندار Northam، مدارس PWCS باید ادامه سال تحصیلی را بسته باشند.  بخاطر تضمین ایمنی و سلامتی دانش آموزان، PWCS قادر نیست خدمات و روزهای آموزشی مربوط به IEPها، برنامه‌های 504، برنامه‌های آموزشی هدیه شده و خدمات ضروری EL را مطابق زمانی که مدارس برای ارائه آموزش باز بودند به دانش آموزان خود ارائه بکند. مدارس و اعضای تیم ما سعی دارند برای فراهم کردن فرصت‌های یادگیری، به چالش کشیدن دانش آموزان، مرور و تقویت درسهای قبلی، برنامه زیر را در زمینه آموزش اجرا کنند. تمام معلمان بصورت مشترک همکاری خواهند کرد و از استراتژی‌های كنشگرايانه برای تداوم مشارکت در یادگیری تمام دانش آموزان از جمله یادگیرندگان زبان انگلیسی، آموزش استثنائی، همزاد شناسایی شده و دانش آموزان استثنایی دوگانه استفاده خواهند کرد تا بتوانند پشتیبانی‌های احتمالی را با توجه به محدودیت‌های یادگیری مجازی و مطابق این شرایط ارائه کنند.

Latest Update

تقدم مدارس مقاطعة الأمير ويليام العامة (PWCS) التحديث التالي فيما يتعلق بالتغييرات التي سببها الإغلاق المتعلق بفيروس COVID-19. يُرجى ملاحظة أن موظفي PWCS يعملون يوميًا لتنسيق المعلومات الأساسية وتطوير التوجيهات بناءً على المعلومات الجديدة. نقدر صبركم ودعمكم خلال هذا الوقت الاستثنائي.

تحديثات 3 أبريل 2020

معلومات جديدة - 

    
عطلة الربيع - الأيام من 6 إلى 10 أبريل هي عطلة الربيع. ستمنح PWCS عطلة الربيع للموظفين والأسر كما هو مُخطَّط لها. يُرجى العلم بأن معظم الموظفين سيكونون في عطلة الأسبوع المقبل كما هو مقرر، ولن يُتوقع منهم الرد على رسائل البريد الإلكتروني أو الاتصالات الأخرى أثناء الإجازة. ستستمر خدمات الغذاء والتغذية المدرسية في تقديم وجبات الطعام خلال عطلة الربيع. سيظل 13 أبريل يوم عمل المعلم المخطط له حيث سيعمل المعلمون عن بُعد. 
    
اجتماع مجلس المدرسة - اجتمع مجلس مدرسة مقاطعة الأمير ويليام يوم الأربعاء، 1 أبريل، للاستماع إلى عرض تقديمي قدمه الدكتور Steve Walts، مشرف المدارس، حول استجابة القسم للوباء. يمكنك مشاهدة اجتماع مجلس المدرسة هنا. تشمل النقاط البارزة من دكتور Walts فيما يتعلق بخطة التعلم التالي: 
    
        
تظل الأولوية القصوى بالنسبة لي هي الصحة البدنية والنفسية للطلاب والموظفين. ليس من الإنصاف أو من الواقعية أن نتوقع من المعلمين والطلاب والإداريين - أو العائلات - استنساخ اليوم الدراسي في المنزل.
    
    
        
أريد من معلمينا أن يعرفوا، ومن طلابنا أن يعرفوا، ومن موظفينا أن يعرفوا - أن كل شيء على ما يرام.
    
    
        
نحن جميعًا في هذا معًا - سنعمل معًا لبذل قصارى جهدنا لدعم بعضنا البعض - وهذا هو ما يهم.
    
    
        
نظرًا لهذا الوقت الاستثنائي الذي نعيشه - أتوقع أن نوفر للطلاب أكبر قدر ممكن من حرية العمل والراحة.
    
    
        
بالتوافق مع إرشادات إدارة التعليم بولاية فيرجينيا، لن تتمكن درجات الطلاب من الارتفاع إلا من حيث كانت في 13 مارس. 
    
    
    
استمرارية التعلم - أصدرت PWCS تفاصيل المرحلة 4 من خطة استمرارية التعلم* لجميع الطلاب، والتي ستبدأ في 14 أبريل بعد عطلة الربيع ويوم عمل المعلم. توفر هذه الخطة توجيهًا أكثر تحديدًا عن Virtual Schoolhouse وكيفية التنقل بنجاح في التعلم افتراضيًا. بالإضافة إلى ذلك، يوفر هذا الجدول الزمني مزيدًا من المعلومات حول جميع المراحل الست لخطة استمرارية التعلم بأكملها. يُطلب من الأسر إعطاء قادة مدرستنا الوقت للعمل مع المعلمين بعد عطلة الربيع، ويوم عمل المعلم، قبل الاتصال بمعلميهم أو مدرستهم لطرح الأسئلة. 
    
مصادر التعليم الخاصة - تم نشر المزيد من الموارد لتقديم الدعم للطلاب ذوي الاحتياجات الخاصة وأسرهم. 
    
معلومات توصيل الوجبة - أنشأت USDA تنازلاً للآباء للسماح لهم باستلام وجبات الطعام مع أطفالهم. ستظل الوجبات متاحة خلال عطلة الربيع. قامت PWCS بتوسيع خدمة توصيل الوجبات إلى ثلاثة مواقع مدرسية أخرى بدءًا من 6 أبريل، بما في ذلك مدرسة Potomac View الابتدائية ومدرسة River Oaks الابتدائية ومدرسة Saunders المتوسطة. يمكن العثور على معلومات أكثر تفصيلاً هنا.  
    
الوصول إلى الكمبيوتر - كما هو موضح في ملاحظات الدكتور Walts (انظر رقم 2 أعلاه)، يجب أن يكون الآباء وأولياء أمور طلاب المدارس الثانوية على دراية باستطلاع الهاتف الأسبوع المقبل لتقييم احتياجات الطلاب الذين قد لا يكون لديهم جهاز كمبيوتر في المنزل. ومن المقرر إجراء استطلاعات لمستويات الدرجات الإضافية في وقت لاحق من هذا الشهر.


تتوفر التحديثات السابقة والمزيد من المعلومات عبر الإنترنت.

*بسبب التحديات المتعلقة بهذا الحدث الصحي العالمي التاريخي والطوارئ الوطنية؛ سيكون من الضروري لفرقنا تكييف طريقة دعمنا لطلابنا. كنتيجة لأمر حاكم الولاية نورثام، يجب أن تظل مدارس PWCS مغلقة طوال الفترة المتبقية من العام الدراسي.  نظرًا لأننا نضمن سلامة الطلاب ورفاههم، لم تعد PWCS قادرة على تقديم يوم دراسي وخدمات للطلاب حول برامج التعليم الفردي، وخطط 504، وخطط تعليم الموهوبين، وخدمات EL المطلوبة كما هو الحال عندما تكون المدارس مفتوحة للتعليم. في مكان التدريس، تنفذ مدارسنا وأعضاء فريقنا الخطة التالية لتزويد الطلاب بفرص للتعلم وتحدي أنفسهم ومراجعة الدروس السابقة واستذكارها. سيعمل جميع المعلمين بشكل تعاوني ويستخدمون استراتيجيات استباقية لمواصلة انخراط جميع الطلاب في التعلم بما في ذلك متعلمي اللغة الإنجليزية لدينا، والتعليم الخاص، والمحددين بشكل ثنائي، والطلاب الاستثنائيين مرتين لتقديم الدعم الممكن نظرًا لقيود التعلم الافتراضي في ظل هذه الظروف.

Latest Update

Prince William کاؤنٹی پبلک سکولز (PWCS)، COVID-19 بندی کے سبب ہوئی تبدیلیوں کے بارے میں درج ذیل اپ ڈیٹ فراہم کر رہا ہے۔  براہ کرم نوٹ کریں کہ PWCS سٹاف کے ممبران کلیدی معلومات کا نظم کرنے اور نئی معلومات پر مبنی رہنمائی تیار کرنے کے لیے روزانہ کام کر رہے ہیں۔ اس غیر معمولی وقت کے دوران آپ کا تحمل اور اعانت لائق تحسین ہے۔

3 اپریل، 2020 کے اپ ڈیٹس

نئی معلومات - 

    
موسم بہار کی چھٹی - 6-10 اپریل، موسم بہار کی چھٹی ہے۔ PWCS منصوبے کے مطابق ملازمین اور خاندانوں کے لیے موسم بہار کی چھٹی کرے گا۔ براہ کرم آگاہ رہیں کہ زیادہ تر عملہ اگلے ہفتے شیڈیول کے مطابق چھٹی پر ہوگا اور ان سے چھٹی کے دوران ای میلز یا دیگر مواصلات کا جواب دینے کی توقع نہیں کی جائے گی۔ سکول فوڈ اینڈ نیوٹریشن سروسز موسم بہار کی چھٹی کے دوران کھانے فراہم کرنا جاری رکھے گی۔ مقررہ منصوبے کے مطابق 13 اپریل بدستور اساتذہ کے لیے کام کا دن ہوگا جس میں اساتذہ فاصلاتی طور پر کام کریں گے۔ 
    
سکول بورڈ کی میٹنگ - Prince William کاؤنٹی سکول بورڈ کی میٹنگ کا انعقاد 1 اپریل کو Dr. Steve Walts، سپرنٹنڈنٹ آف سکولز کے ذریعہ وباء کے حوالے سے ڈویژن کے ردعمل پر پیش کیے گئے ایک پریزنٹیشن کو سننے کے لیے کیا گیا۔ آپ اس بورڈ میٹنگ کو یہاں دیکھ سکتے ہیں۔ تعلیمی منصوبے کے بارے میں Dr. Walts کے پریزنٹیشن کی جھلکیوں میں شامل ہیں: 
    
        
میری اعلی ترین ترجیح بدستور طلباء اور عملے کی جسمانی اور ذہنی صحت ہے۔ یہ بات نہ تو مناسب ہے، نہ حقیقت پسندانہ کہ ہمارے اساتذہ، طلباء، اور منتظمین - یا خاندانوں سے- گھر پر سکولی دن کی عکاسی کرنے کو کہا جائے۔
    
    
        
میں اپنے اساتذہ کو بتانا چاہتا ہوں، اپنے طلباء کو بتانا چاہتا ہوں، اور اپنے سٹاف کو بتانا چاہتا ہوں کہ - یہ مناسب ہے۔
    
    
        
ہم سبھی اس معاملے میں ساتھ ہیں - ہم ایک دوسرے کی اعانت کے لیے جو بہتر سے بہتر کر سکتے ہیں اسے کرنے کے لیے ساتھ مل کر کام کریں گے - اور یہی بات اہم ہے۔
    
    
        
ہم جس غیر معمولی وقت سے گزر رہے ہیں – میری توقع ہے کہ ہم طلباء کو ممکنہ حد تک زیادہ سے زیادہ کشادگی اور رعایتیں فراہم کریں۔ 
    
    
        
ورجینیا کے محکمہ تعلیم کی رہنمائی کے مطابق، طلباء کے گریڈز صرف وہیں سے آگے بڑھیں گے جہاں وہ 13 مارچ کو تھے۔

         
    
    
    
تعلیم کا تسلسل – PWCS نے تمام طلباء کے لیے تعلیمی تسلسل کے منصوبے کےمرحلہ 4 کی تفصیلات جاری کی ہیں، جس کا آغاز 14 اپریل کو موسم بہار کی چھٹی اور اساتذہ کے کام والے دن کے بعد ہوگا۔ یہ منصوبہ ورچؤل سکول ہاؤس (Virtual Schoolhouse) اور اس بارے میں مزید خصوصی ہدایت فرہم کرتا ہے کہ ورچؤل طور پر آموزش کو کامیابی کے ساتھ کیسے آگے بڑھایا جائے۔ اس کے علاوہ وقت کی یہ حد پورے تعلیمی تسلسل کے منصوبے کے تمام چھ مراحل پر مزید معلومات فراہم کرتی ہے۔ خاندانوں سے کہا گیا ہے کہ وہ موسم بہار کی چھٹی، اور اساتذہ کے کام والے دن کے بعد اپنے اساتذہ یا سکول سے سوالات کے ساتھ رابطہ کرنے سے قبل، ہمارے سکول لیڈرز کو ان کے اساتذہ کے ساتھ کام کرنے کا موقع دیں۔ 
    
خصوصی تعلیمی وسائل – خصوصی ضروریات والے طلباء اور ان کے خاندانوں کے لیے مزید وسائل پوسٹ کیے جا رہے ہیں۔ 
    
کھانا لینے کی معلومات – USDA نے والدین کے لیے ایک استثناء جاری کیا ہے کہ وہ اپنے بچوں کے ساتھ کھانا لے جا سکتے ہیں۔ موسم بہار کی چھٹی کے دوران کھانے بدستور دستیاب رہیں گے۔ PWCS نے 6 اپریل سے توسیع کرتے ہوئے مزید تین سکول کے مقامات پر کھانا لینے کا انتظام کیا ہے، جس میں Potomac View Elementary School، River Oaks Elementary School اور Saunders Middle School شامل ہیں۔ مزید تفصیلی معلومات یہاں دیکھی جا سکتی ہیں۔ 
    
کمپیوٹر رسائی – جیسا کہ اوپر Dr. Walts کے تبصروں میں بتایا گيا ہے (اوپر نمبر 2 دیکھیں)، ہائی سکول کے طلباء کے والدین اور سرپرستوں کو اگلے ہفتے فون سروے سے آگاہ رہنا چاہیے جو ان طلباء کی ضروریات کی تشخیص کے لیے ہے جن کے پاس ممکن ہے گھر پر کمپیوٹر نہ ہو۔ مزید گریڈ لیولز کے لیے سرویز کا وقت اس مہینے بعد میں مقرر کیا جائے گا۔


سابقہ اپ ڈیٹس اور مزید معلومات آن لائن دستیاب ہیں۔

*عالمی صحت کے اس تاریخی واقعہ اور ملکی ایمرجنسی سے متعلق چیلنجز کے سبب؛ ہماری ٹیموں کے لیے اس بارے میں مطابقت پیدا کرنا ضروری ہوگا کہ ہم کس طرح اپنے طلباء کی مدد کر سکتے ہیں۔ گورنر نارتھم (Governor Northam) کے حکم کے نتیجے میں، PWCS کو بقیہ سکولی سال کے لیے بدستور بند رکھنا ہوگا۔  چونکہ ہم طلباء کے تحفظ اور بہبود کو یقینی بناتے ہیں، لہذا PWCS اب اپنے طلباء کو مزید تدریسی دن اور IEPs، 504 پلانز، گفٹڈ ایجوکیشن پلانز میں مذکور خدمات، اور مطلوبہ EL سروسز فراہم نہیں کر سکتا کیونکہ یہ تبھی ہوپاتا جب اسکول تدریس کے لیے کھلے ہوتے۔ تدریس کی جگہ پر، ہمارے سکولز اور ٹیم ممبران طلباء کو تعلیم حاصل کرنے، خود کو چیلنج کرنے، اور سابقہ اسباق کو دہرانے اور یاد رکھنے کے مواقع فراہم کرنے کے لیے درج ذیل منصوبے کو نافذ کر رہے ہیں۔ تمام طلباء، بشمول ہمارے انگریزی کے متعلمین، خصوصی تعلیم، دولسانی طور پر شناخت کردہ، اور دوہری استثناء والے طلباء کے لیے تعلیم میں مصروفیت جاری رکھنے کے لیے سبھی اساتذہ مل کر کام کریں گے اور ورچؤل تعلیم کی تحدیدات کے سبب ان حالات میں انہیں ہر ممکن اعانت فراہم کریں گے۔

Latest Update

关于新型冠状病毒 (COVID-19) 导致学校关闭的变化，威廉王子郡公立学校 (PWCS) 提供以下更新。请注意，PWCS 工作人员每天都在接收和处理关键信息，并根据新信息来制订指导。在这个特殊时刻，感谢大家的耐心与支持。

2020 年 4 月 3 日更新

新信息 –  

    
春假——4 月 6 日至 10 日是春假。PWCS 将按计划为员工及家属安排春假。请注意，大多数员工下周将按原计划休假，休假期间将无需回复电子邮件或其他通讯。春假期间，学校食品和营养服务中心将继续提供膳食。4 月 13 日将继续是远程办公的教师的计划工作日。  
    
学校董事会会议 - 威廉王子郡学校董事会于 4 月 1 日星期三举行会议，听取地方教育官员 Steve Walts 博士关于该司应对新冠大流行的报告。你可以在这里观看学校董事会会议。Walts 博士关于学习计划的要点包括：  
    
        
我的首要任务仍然是保护学生和工作人员的身心健康。期望我们的教师、学生、管理人员或家人在家里重复上学的日子是不公平的，也是不现实的。
        
我想让我们的教师知道，让我们的学生知道，让我们的员工知道——没关系。
        
我们都团结在一起，我们将一起努力，尽我们所能互相支持，这才是最重要的。
        
鉴于我们所处的这个非常时刻，我希望我们能够为学生提供尽可能多的自由和关怀。
        
与维吉尼亚州教育厅的指导相一致，学生的等级只能从 3 月 13 日的水平提高。  
    
    
    
学习连续性 - PWCS 已公布了面向所有学生的“连续性学习计划*第 4 阶段”的详情，它将于 4 月 14 日春假及教师工作日之后开始实施。该计划为虚拟课堂以及如何成功地掌握虚拟学习提供了更具体的指导。此外，该时间表还提供了关于整个学习连续性计划的全部六个阶段的进一步信息。家长们在与教师或学校联系问题之前，需要给学校领导一些时间，以便在春假和教师工作日之后与教师进行合作。
    
特殊教育资源 - 已经发布更多资源，为有特殊需要的学生和他们的家庭提供支持。
    
取餐信息 -USDA（美国农业部）已经建立了一项豁免权，允许父母和他们的孩子一起取餐。春假期间将继续提供膳食。从 4 月 6 日开始，PWCS 已将食堂扩大到另外三个学校，包括 Potomac View 小学、River Oaks 小学和 Saunders 中学。可以在这里 找到更详细的信息。 
    
电脑获取 - 正如 Walts 博士所说（见上文第 2 点），中学生的家长和监护人应该注意下周的电话调查，以评估那些家里可能没有电脑的学生的需求。有关额外成绩水平的调查将于本月稍后进行。


之前的更新和更多信息可在线上查找。

*由于与这一历史性的世界卫生事件和国家紧急状态相关的挑战；我们的团队有必要调整我们为学生提供支持的方式。根据州长 Northam 的命令，PWCS 学校必须在本学年余下的时间内继续关闭。  由于我们要确保学生的安全及福祉，因此 PWCS 不能再像学校开放教学时一样，为学生提供 IEP、504 计划、资优教育计划及所需的 EL 服务。在教学场所方面，我们的学校和团队成员正在实施以下计划，为学生提供学习的机会，挑战自我，并复习和巩固过去的课程。所有教师将协同工作，并使用积极主动的策略，继续参与所有学生的学习，包括我们的英语学习者、特殊教育、双重识别和两个特殊学生。在目前的状况下，我们将在考虑虚拟学习局限性的前提下，提供尽可能多的支持。
